title: Porn App Snaps User's Photo, Demands Ransom
content:
Posted Tuesday, September 8th 2015 @ 2pm  by Neal Colgrass,  Newser Staff 
 

 
( NEWSER ) – If you've used Adult Player, sorry to hear it: It's an Android porn app that takes a photo of you with the phone's front-facing camera, immobilizes the device, and demands a $500 payment via a locked ransom screen to fix the phone and delete the photo. This according to security experts at  Zscaler , who identified the malware, which it describes as "ransomware [that] acts as a porn app." 
 
But even people who paid the Adult Player ransom (via PayPal) have said their phones still don't work,  Sky News  reports. According to Zscaler, the only way out is to reboot the device in safe mode, strip the app of its administrator privilege, and then delete the app. It also notes that Adult Player can't be found in the Google Play store, where, for security reasons, users should buy all of their apps.
